Posts.Title: scans

Posts.Title: scans

Posts.Content: Hi, I have had a WLE in March which included a Axillary Node clearance, 1 node out of 11 cancerous. I have just finished FEC-T chemo and due to start 30 Rads on 20th October and also tamoxifen. I read lots of ladies posts here who have had other scans whereas I have had none, only a chest xray and that was because I was admitted with infection during chemo and they were checking for chest infection. When I asked my Oncologist about further scans to check to see if it had spread she said I didn't need them due to my results being what they were and having chemo and rads. Having now finished my chemo I feel scared, my safety net has gone and the what ifs are buzzing round my head. Should I push for further scans, is it normal not to have scans?
Posts.Title: scans

Posts.Content: http://community.macmillan.org.uk/cancer_types/breast-cancer/f/38/p/83436/706552.aspx#706552 I can't work out how to post a link the article in the link above is well worth a read, it helped me so much, I hope Dreamthief reads this and can post a proper link. You are not irrational at all, I finished my chemo 3 weeks ago and I feel the same, safety net gone, I do have radiotherapy to come and hormone treatment to come but its scary. Hope you can find the article and it helps you a little x
Posts.Title: 5th Chemo done 1 more to go , should be happy .....but

Posts.Content: I had a PICC line inserted after my first chemo and I am so pleased I did, I didn't find the insertion painful, slightly uncomfortable but so worth it as I didn't have to have anymore needles for bloods or chemo which was such a relief for me, especially as I ended up being admitted twice during chemo so lots of extra bloods taken and intravenous antibiotics all administered by my PICC! The only issues I had was that my skin reacted to the dressings but they used different ones and all ok. The line has to be flushed and dressed weekly and I had a choice of district nurse or going into chemo unit and I think some folk look after it themselves. I would definitely recommend one to you, good luck with whatever u decide xx
Posts.Title: picc lines

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone, Getting myself into an anxious mess, I am 8 weeks post chemo FEC-T and suffering with joint and muscle pain, I have been to my GP who has done blood test, bloods all fine, including calcium level which is apparently and indicator of bone cancer. Also have varicose vein pain which I didn't have before chemo, well I had the varicose veins but they weren't painful just occasionally itchy. I am 3 weeks through a 6 weeks weeks of Rads and Doc has suggested if pain no better after rads finished I should go back and discuss. I have tried to keep so upbeat about my treatment so far and have largely, with a few wobbles, managed it but i feel so exhausted and low that I'm beginning to struggle :(
Posts.Title: varicose veins

Posts.Content: Thank you Keeker for your very sound advice. I am sorry to hear you were low durings rads I hope you're doing ok now, best wishes x
Posts.Title: varicose veins

Posts.Content: This is an excellent article, I'm not coping well after my last chemo despite having radiotherapy to go, basically I'm scared of the future and what it may hold. During chemo I seemed to just focus on getting through that and all its side effects, now all I can think is what if it comes back, what if its already spread etc etc......
Posts.Title: i fell apart

Posts.Content: Hi, I also had some bleeding at the corner of my wound, happened to be the day I went for my results and the surgeon said it was nothing to worry about and to keep it clean and if I was at all concerned to get in touch. So probably best to get it looked to put your mind at rest. X
Posts.Title: Tiny bleed from wound 2 weeks after surgery
